meanings.definition: A situation in which two companies dominate a particular market or industry.
meanings.sent1: In the world of duopolies, two giant companies control everything.
meanings.sent2: Duopolies can lead to limited choices for consumers.
meanings.sent3: The duopolies in the tech industry sometimes act like twins, always copying each other.
meanings.sent4: The duopolies in the beverage market are like two kings ruling over their kingdom.
meanings.sent5: When discussing duopolies, imagine a seesaw with only two players trying to stay balanced.

meanings.definition: The market condition that exists when there are only two sellers.
meanings.sent1: Duopolies can create fierce competition between the two sellers.
meanings.sent2: In duopolies, pricing strategies can greatly impact the market.
meanings.sent3: The duopolies in the neighborhood lemonade stand business always try to outdo each other.
meanings.sent4: The duopolies in the online book market are like two bookworms in a never-ending battle.
meanings.sent5: When visualizing duopolies, picture a race with only two runners competing for the finish line.
